isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION CARRIERS: ROCKWELL - REASSEMBLE - INSTALL THE DRIVE PINION, BEARING CAGE AND SHIM PACK INTO THE CARRIER

svcproc.title: INSTALL THE DRIVE PINION, BEARING CAGE AND SHIM PACK INTO THE CARRIER

note.para: If a new drive pinion and ring gear set is installed, or if the depth of the drive pinion has to be adjusted, calculate the thickness of the shim pack. Refer to ADJUST THICKNESS OF SHIM PACK FOR THE PINION CAGE.

step1.para: Install the correct shim pack between the bearing cage and carrier ( Figure 81).

figure.caption: Figure 81. Install Correct Shim Pack Between Bearing Cage and Carrier

step1.para: Align the oil slots in the shims with oil slots in the bearing cage and carrier. The use of guide studs will help align the shims ( Figure 81).

note.para: Use a minimum of three shims in a pack. If the pack is made from different thickness shims, install the thinnest shims on both sides of the pack for maximum sealing.

step1.para: Install the drive pinion and bearing cage into the carrier. If necessary, use a rubber, plastic or leather mallet to hit the assembly into position ( Figure 82).

figure.caption: Figure 82. Install Drive Pinion and Bearing Cage into Carrier

warning.para: Wear safe eye protection. Do not hit steel parts with a steel hammer. Parts can break and cause injury.

step1.para: If used, install the cover * and seal assembly and gasket* over the bearing cage ( Figure 83).

figure.caption: Figure 83. Install Cover and Seal Assembly and Gasket Over Bearing Cage

step1.para: Align the oil slots in the cover * and gasket * with oil slot in the bearing cage.
Install the bearing cage to carrier capscrews and washers. Tighten capscrews to correct torque value ( Figure 84). Refer to the TORQUE CHART.

figure.caption: Figure 84. Install Bearing Cage to Carrier Capscrews and Washers

step1.para: Install the input yoke or flange, nut and washer * on the drive pinion. The yoke or flange MUST be against the outer bearing.

note.para: If the fit between the yoke or flange splines and drive pinion splines is tight, use the three- piece pilot tool for installation. Refer to INSTALL TIGHT FIT YOKES.

caution.para: Do not install tight fit yokes or flanges on shafts using a hammer or mallet. A hammer or mallet will damage the yoke or flange and/or bearing.

step1.para: Tighten the pinion nut to the correct torque value ( Figure 85). Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
